result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • William Raymond Engler was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for unpaid court obligations.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Driver License is revoked for 2 years

IID for a period of 2yrs to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.  IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY

miscConds.notes: Huber is allowed after the first 48 hours.

DNA Sample must be provided 
Defendant must successfully complete the SCVRJ Victim Impact Panel.
Court Order for Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed

timeConds.notes:
6 Month Jail Sentence stayed until April 30, 2015 at 7:00 PM. Jail sentenct may be served in Martin County MN if at no cost to Pierce County and the defendant makes the arrangements.

Electronic Home Monitoring approved on 5/7/2015, provided there is no cost to Pierce County.

from Trisha Gilby requesting jail commencment date be reset to 4-20-15 and response by Wm Thorie
Associated with Charge #1

3:01 Defendant William Raymond Engler in court with attorney Patrick J. Costello.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14TR640 heard at this time. Thorie: guilty to Ct#1 contained in the information. Dismiss Ct#2 and 14TR640. 2 years probation: 6 months jail, 2 year revocation DL, $2452.00 fine. IID, AODA and driver safety plan. DNA surcharge and sample. No objection to Def serving time in Martin County. Costello and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1; Costello stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. COurt finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1. Dismisses Ct#2 and 14TR640. Thorie and Costello address sentencing. Court: S/W 2 years probation conditions: 6 months jail stayed on or before March 13, 2015 at 7pm and may serve this in Martin County MN as long as it doesn't cost Pierce County. Huber allowed. 2 years revocation of DL, $2752 fine. ($50 IID surcharge, $250 DNA surchargeand $2452 fine due in 30 days)  IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY  IID for a period of 2 year to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def. AODA and driver safety plan and participate in Victim Impact Panel through St Croix Restorative Justice. DNA sample and surcharge.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Vote rights sheet.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-09-2015 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 10, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Def pleas not guilty to charges. Court enters not guilty pleas. Court goes over bond conditions with Def. Bond to remain. 14TR640 to be set along with 14CF172. Def to remain until he is handed a notice for next hearing.

3:04 Defendant William Raymond Engler in court with attorney Patrick J. Costello.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14TR640 to follow along.  Def wishes to waive his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court goes over Preliminary Questionnaire and Waiver form with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Court accepts and approves waiver, finds the Def probably commited a felony and binds the Def over. Thorie files information; Def has a copy. Court reads charges and maximum penalties; Def waives further reading.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

10:20 This also includes 14TR640  Defendant William Raymond Engler in court with attorney Patrick J. Costello.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Defednatn waives the time limit for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
